content:
• Thursday, November 30, 2017
  • LLNW

    Limelight Networks -2.1% on pricing 15M-share offering

    • Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) is 2.1% lower on heavy postmarket volume after pricing a public offering of 15M shares, at $4.60/share.
    • Shares had fallen 9.2% during the regular session today after announcing the offering, to close at $4.86.
    • Limelight doesn't receive any proceeds on the offering, which is on behalf of selling stockholders affiliated with Goldman Sachs.
    • B. Riley was the sole book-runner.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: FMI +5.4%. NTNX +4.4%. ANFI +3.2%. LTM +2.6%. AUY +2.4%.
    • Top losers: ULTA -5.9%. ZUMZ -3.2%. YEXT -3.0%. LLNW -2.5%. AAV-OLD -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • FMI

    FDA OKs Foundation Med's CDx cancer test; shares up 2% after hours

    • The FDA approves the FoundationOne CDx, a next-gen sequencing (NGS)-based in vitro diagnostic test that can detect mutations in 324 genes and two genomic signatures in any solid tumor type.
    • CMS will cover reimbursement for Medicare beneficiaries with advanced cancers who have not been previously tested using the same NGS technology and who continue to seek further cancer therapy.
    • Developer Foundation Medicine (NASDAQ:FMI) is up 2% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOSY

    MoSys +6% after regaining Nasdaq compliance

    • MoSys (NASDAQ:MOSY) announces receiving a letter from the Nasdaq saying the company has regained compliance with the market’s minimum bid price requirement.
    • MoSys shares are up 6% aftermarket.       
    • Previously: Benchmark upgrades MoSys to Speculative Buy (Nov. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • VMW

    VMware +2.1% after Q3 beats (update)

    • VMware (NYSE:VMW) shares are up 2.1% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Key metrics: License revenue, $785M (+14% Y/Y); Services revenue, $1.19B (+10%); unearned revenue, $5.6B; operating cash flows, $970M; FCF, $911M; cash and equivalents, $11.6B.
    • Will update with guidance after the earnings call.
    • Press release
    • Previously: VMware beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Nov. 30)
    • Update with guidance: Q4 guidance has revenue at $2.26B (consensus: $2.23B) and EPS at $1.62, which matches consensus.
    • FY19 revenue expected to grow 10% on the year to $8.66B compared to the $8.39B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTNX

    Nutanix +3.4% after Q1 beats, upside guidance as software push pays off

    • Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) shares are up 3.4% aftermarket following Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates. Q2 guidance has revenue from $280M to $285M (consensus: $282M) and EPS from -$0.22 to -$0.20 (consensus: -$0.25).
    • Key metrics: Billings, $315.3M (+32% Y/Y); operating expenses, $233.3M; cash and investments, $365.9M (+5%); deferred revenue, $408.8M (+48%); operating cash flow, $10.1M; FCF, -$7.9M. 
    • Customer adds: +760 new end-customers in Q1 to end with 7,813 customers. New customers include Scholastic, Toyota, and ConocoPhillips. 49 customers had deals over $1, up 36% on the year. 
    • Key quote on software shift: "While we will be focusing even more intently on selling software going forward, it's worth noting what the past twelve months would have looked like had we chosen not to bill any pass-through hardware-related transactions. Nutanix would have recorded nearly $800 million in pure software and support billings and delivered gross margins above 80%, while continuing to be a leader in very large market," says CFO Duston Williams. 
    • Press release 
    • Previously: Nutanix beats by $0.10, beats on revenue (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 8 Comments
  • AMBA

    Ambarella +5% after Q3 beats, in-line guidance

    • Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) shares are up 5% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates and included in-line guidance.
    • Q4 guidance: revenue, $68M to $72M (consensus: $70.27M); non-GAAP gross margin, 62% to 63.5%; operating expenses, $28.5M to $30M.
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 64% (-2.3% Y/Y); total operating expenses, $41.5M; cash and equivalents, $414M (+$42M); Q3 stock repurchases, 269, 540 shares for $12.8M. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Ambarella beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 6 Comments
  • BXMT

    Capital raise for Blackstone Mortgage Trust

    • The company is selling 10.8M shares with 1.62M underwriter greenshoe.
    • BXMT -1.3% after hours
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 13 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Beauty lower on merchandise margin pressure

    • Ulta Beauty (NASDAQ:ULTA) tops profit estimates with its Q3 report.
    • Comparable sales were up 10.3% during the quarter. Ulta recorded 6.0% transaction growth and saw a 4.3% increase in average ticket.
    • E-commerce sales were up 63% to $120M.
    • Despite the strong sales growth, gross margin fell 110 bps to 36.7% off a lower merchandise margin.
    • Looking ahead, Ulta expects a 10% to 11% gain in comparable sales during Q4. Revenue is seen coming in at $1.926B to $1.959B vs. $1.93B consensus and EPS of $2.73 to $2.78 is anticipated vs. $2.84 consensus.
    • Previously: Ulta Beauty EPS of $1.70 (Nov. 30)
    • ULTA -6.02% AH to $208.31.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 37 Comments
  • FIVE

    Five Below beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE): Q3 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $257.2M (+28.9% Y/Y) beats by $11.14M.
    • Shares +4.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • CELG

    Celgene's softer guidance for 2020 pressures shares, down 2%

    • Celgene (CELG -2.1%) looks like it will finish the day in the red after it disclosed softer 2020 guidance at the Evercore ISI Biopharma Catalyst/Deep Dive Conference.
    • 2020 outlook: $19B - 20B from $21B; EPS: $12.50 from $13.00. Adjustment made due to pipeline failure (mongersen).
    • Previously: Celgene hits bump in road with IBD candidate GED-0301, two studies terminated; shares poised for down move after hours (Oct. 19)
    • Update: The revised guidance was reported in the company's Q3 earnings call on October 26.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 40 Comments
  • NLY

    Rough session for mREITs as rates head higher

    • The two-year Treasury yield has carved out a new five-year high today, up 2.4 basis points to 1.786%. With the 10-year Treasury yield at 2.42%, that leaves just about a 63 basis point spread between the two.
    • That's not great news for the income outlook for mortgage REITs, particularly the agency players, and also at a time when many are trading above book value.
    • Annaly Capital (NLY -1.4%), AGNC Investment (AGNC -1.3%), CYS Investments (CYS -2%), Capstead Mortgage (CMO -2%), Western Asset (WMC -1.6%), AG Mortgage (MITT -2.1%), Ellington Residential (EARN -1%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 53 Comments
  • AMGN

    Biotechs one of top groups in bullish day

    • Biotech longs are having a good day today. The SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI +2.6%) is up on increased volume as it breaks through brief consolidation.
    • Selected tickers: (AMGN +2%)(BIIB +0.7%)(VRTX +0.3%)(CELG -2.2%)(GILD +1.1%)(ALNY +4.8%)(IONS +4%)(BLUE +3.5%)(JUNO +0.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 18 Comments
  • RGC

    Deal price on Regal Entertainment buyout said to be agreed upon

    • Another turn in the Regal Entertainment (NYSE:RGC)-Cineworld Group (OTC:CNWGY) arrives after dealReporter says the deal has been agreed upon at $23 per share.
    • Earlier in the day, concerns over Cineworld's ability to finance the acquisition entered the equation.
    • Regal is now up 1.4% after being in negative territory for the last few hours.
    • Previously: Regal Entertainment drops on report of Cineworld financing hiccup (Nov. 30)
    • Previously: Theater stocks follow Regal lower (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMZN

    Amazon officially announces Alexa for Business

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Web Services officially announces Alexa for Business.
    • CNBC sources leaked the news yesterday, but the announcement came during the Re: Invent conference today. 
    • Alexa for Business supports skills and integrations from partners including Salesforce, Concur, RingCentral, Splunk, and Polycom. Business also works with Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Exchange, and Google G Suite. 
    • Enterprise users can build custom private skills to integrate with IT applications and office systems. 
    • The Alexa for Business Starter Kit is available today in the U.S. for about $793. The kit includes 3 Echo devices, 2 Echo Dots, and 2 Echo Shows.    
    • Amazon shares are up 0.8%.    
    • Previously: CNBC: Amazon.com readying Alexa platform for business users (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 27 Comments
  • RYTM

    Rhythm Pharma's setmelanotide an Orphan Drug in U.S. for leptin receptor deficiency; shares up 5%

    • The FDA designates Rhythm Pharmaceuticals' (RYTM +4.9%) setmelanotide an Orphan Drug for the treatment of leptin receptor deficiency, an inherited disorder characterized by extreme obesity.
    • Among the benefits of Orphan Drug status in the U.S. is a seven-year period of market exclusivity for the indication, if approved.
    • Phase 3-stage setmelanotide binds to and activates receptors in the brain's hypothalamus called MC4 that are thought to play a key role in the regulation of appetite. In addition to suppressing appetite, setmelanotide increases energy expenditure in obese people without increasing heart rate or blood pressure.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • CIE

    What's in a name? Plenty, it seems, as Cobalt Energy doubles this week

    • Cobalt International Energy (CIE +4.4%) nearly doubled this week after the one-time high flier sank to a mere $0.36/share as bankruptcy speculation mounted.
    • But WSJ's Spencer Jakab attributes this week's gains to the mere fact that "cobalt" is in the name of the company; electric car makers are worried about maintaining sufficient supplies of the metal, and investors are clamoring for a piece of the action.
    • "In the absence of any other news, that may have been all it took for Cobalt the company to soar by as much as 80%," Jakab writes; of course, the company merely drills for oil and gas.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: OTC:PRKR +31%. IMMR +22%. XNET +12%. ELTK +9%. MARK +8%.
    • Losers: SGH -13%. SNCR -11%. PTI -11%. LLNW -9%. CNIT-OLD -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 6 Comments
  • INTU

    Intuit hires 1K CPAs for on demand assistance

    • Fast Company reports that Intuit (NASDAQ:INTU) is hiring over 1K CPAs and enrolled agents to offer on demand assistance to tax filers using TurboTax.
    • Users will have to pay $150 per filing for the service that includes a video call with an accountant often available within 15 minutes. Customers can see the advisor, but the advisor can’t see the customer.   
    • Intuit shares are up 0.97%.         
    • Previously: Intuit selects AWS for machine learning and AI platform (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • PNK

    Pinnacle confirms talks with Penn National

    • Pinnacle Entertainment (NASDAQ:PNK) confirms today's report that it's in talks with Penn National Gaming (PENN +1.2%) about a cash and stock merger.
    • The company says that it doesn't intend to comment further on market speculation about a deal.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Penn National-Pinnacle merger talk heats up again (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • CXW

    CoreCivic up more than 1% after Kansas contract win

    • The Kansas Dept. of Corrections awards CoreCivic (CXW +1.2%) the contract to replace the state's oldest and largest jail. The new prison will have room for 2.4K inmates.
    • CoreCivic's role will just be to build the facility and handle repairs and upkeep. The State will lease the property from the company for 20 years at $15M per.
    • GEO Group (GEO +0.5%) also bid on the project, but lost out to CoreCivic's lower proposal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 5 Comments
  • RTW

    E-commerce helps New York & Company turn a profit

    • New York & Company (NWY) is up 19% after the retailer turned a narrow profit in Q3.
    • Comparable sales rose 2.2% during the quarter to top the mall sector average. Double-digit e-commerce growth helped the retailer keep its comp in positive territory.
    • Looking ahead, management expects total sales and comparable sales to be up at a low single-digit rate in the crucial holiday quarter.
    • Previously: New York & Company reports Q3 results (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • IMAX

    Theater stocks follow Regal lower

    • The up and down trading continues in the exhibitor sector day after some questions are raised on if Cineworld can string together the financing to acquire Regal Entertainment.
    • IMAX (IMAX -2.5%), AMC Entertainment (AMC -7%), Cinemark (CNK -3%) and Marcus Corporation (MCS -3.5%) have all followed Regal lower.
    • Previously: Regal Entertainment drops on report of Cineworld financing hiccup (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: NOG +11%. MCF +7%. VOC +7%. EEP +7%. ESES +6%.
    • Losers: AXTA -15%. GURE -7%. LGCY -7%. WG -6%. GSV -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 17 Comments
  • PPG

    PPG, RPM, HB Fuller all give ground after Axalta deal collapses

    • Axalta has tumbled as much as 20% after buyout talks with Nippon Paint ended without a deal.
    • Peers aren't hurting nearly as badly, but the trio of PPG Industries (PPG -0.1%), RPM International (RPM -0.6%), and HB Fuller (FUL -0.5%) are all lower now than prior to the news.
    • Previously: Axalta Coating -20% as Nippon Paint ends potential merger talks (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 2 Comments

  • Stock surge sends bond prices and gold south

    • Tax cut optimism is making for a good excuse to keep buying shares, with the Dow ahead 1.4% to $24,275, the S&P 500 up 1%, and the Nasdaq higher by 0.75%.
    • Who needs gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) in this environment. Holding flat for much of the day, the metal is now down 1% to $1,273 per ounce. The 10-year Treasury yield has hit its highest level in more than a month, up four basis points to 2.43%. TLT -0.75%, TBT +1.5%
    • No report on asset prices these days is complete without Bitcoin, and it's back in rally mode after nearly falling back through $9K, now down just 1.3% today to $9,699.
    • Previously: Tax cut optimism helps fuel continued rally (Nov. 30)
    • Previously: Bitcoin correction nears 20% as IRS moves in (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 7 Comments
  • GT

    Morgan Stanley sees Goodyear Tire & Rubber burning higher

    • Morgan Stanley analyst Adam Jonas thinks Goodyear Tire Rubber (GT +1.1%) will benefit as EV sales take off over the next few years.
    • Jonas says not only will total road miles accelerate in the future, but EV cars will need be replaced quicker than ICE alternatives due to wear and tear from additional torque and extra weight.
    • "The Tesla Model S weighs 20% more than its ICE comparable class average, and the Chevrolet Bolt EV weighs over 36% more than its ICE comparable class average," observes Jonas.
    • Shares of Goodyear Tire and Rubber are up 7% over the last 90 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 4 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:15 PM

    • Gainers: FAC +9%. CNFR +8%.GROW +7%.
    • Losers: JTPY -12%. NOAH -8%. UVSP -7%. OCSL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • PENN

    Penn National-Pinnacle merger talk heats up again

    • Penn National Gaming (PENN +1.4%) and Pinnacle Entertainment (PNK +3.8%) are closer to striking a deal to merge, sources tell The Wall Street Journal.
    • Pinnacle is expected to be valued in the low $30s if final terms are agreed upon.
    • Today's report isn't the first time that PENN-PNK merger talks are said to have heated up.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell resumed Equal Weight by Morgan Stanley

    • Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB) is off 1.8% after coverage has been resumed at Morgan Stanley with an Equal Weight rating.
    • Shares are down to $21.50 today, generally in line with consensus price targets; Morgan Stanley has a price target of $24, implying 11.6% upside from today's lower price.
    • The stock is down 3.8% overall in 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • AXTA

    Axalta Coating -20% as Nippon Paint ends potential merger talks

    • Axalta Coating Systems (AXTA -19.6%) says potential merger talks with Nippon Paint have ended, with the Japanese company "unwilling to meet our expectations regarding the value of the company and assume the financial leverage necessary for a deal of this size."
    • As recently as today, the Nikkei Asian Review reported that Nippon Paint was in final negotiations on a bid to buy AXTA in a deal likely to be valued at more than $8.9B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASMB

    Assembly Bio continues up move, shares ahead 9%

    • Thinly traded Assembly Biosciences (ASMB +8.6%) is up on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of less than 300K. Shares have rallied 88% since the low of $27 on November 2.
    • The company's lead candidate is ABI-H0731, a core protein allosteric modifier (CpAM) for the potential cure of chronic hepatitis B virus infection. An 80-subject Phase 1/2 dose-ranging and initial efficacy study is in process. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated primary completion date is next month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • SD

    Icahn slams SandRidge, says 'makes a banana republic look good'

    • SandRidge Energy (SD +3.5%) "makes a banana republic look good," top shareholder Carl Icahn tells CNBC, ratcheting up the war of words following the company's adoption of a poison pill blocking anyone from amassing a 10% stake in its common stock.
    • In a letter to SD, Icahn slammed the move and called the Bonanza Creek purchase, announced on Nov. 15, "dilutive, overpriced and value-destroying."
    • Icahn says he is prepared to take legal action against the company if it perceives that the board aims to prevent shareholders from communicating.
    • On the stock market rally, Icahn says "even though earnings are going to be very good... I just think this thing has gotten into a euphoric state."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 5 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: NWY +23%. OTC:ARDM +23%. IMMR +21%. HOME +18%. TLYS +17%. TITN +16%. NOG +15%. VSTM +14%. MIK +13%. MDGL +12%.
    • Losers: OTCQB:MRDN -22%. MYO -22%. CPL -21%. PZRX -15%. REED -14%. FUV -14%. JTPY -13%. CHEK -13%. SGH -13%. ANFI -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • VZ

    Analysts fret 'squishy' 5G broadband talk from Verizon

    • Analysts are coming away less than totally impressed from an analyst day at Verizon (VZ +1.8%), which was highlighted by the company's announcement of plans for a commercial 5G rollout in 2018.
    • As far as extending that service into homes as a main source of broadband, Verizon mentioned a total addressable market of 25-30% of American homes.
    • But what happens when the other three wireless players target that same subset, asks Craig Moffett? It would be subdivided among them, or in an alternate outcome, providers could skip cities already entered by rivals.
    • "That would create a truly bizarre market dynamic that is almost unimaginable today, where each operator 'owned' different cities, not just for FWBB (fixed wireless broadband) but also for 4G LTE," he writes, which might then call for companies to reciprocally wholesale networks. He says Verizon's presentation was "rather squishy" and "so murky as to be unforecastable."
    • Verizon's fixed-wireless implementation looks "clunky" and short on pricing approach, says Instinet's Jeffrey Kvaal, and thinks the company should have talked about mobile more instead. Cowen's Colby Synesael noted the presentation was short on financials as well, making a payoff hard to determine.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 29 Comments

  • Tax cut optimism helps fuel continued rally

    • With professional presidential thorn John McCain saying he's a "yes" on the tax bill, passage of corporate tax cuts looks even more assured.
    • Today's rally is a broad one, with the financial sector (XLF +1.2%) leading the way. The Dow (DIA +1%) is performing the best among the major averages, up more than 200 points to 24,150.
    • The S&P 500 is up 0.7%, and the Nasdaq 0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 262 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: HOME +15%. ICON +8%. LZB +6%. DFBG-OLD +6%. UQM +5%.
    • Losers: FUV -16%. REED -14%. ANFI -12%. SANW -8%. FBR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • TDW

    Tidewater reaches settlement with shipyard to resolve dispute

    • Tidewater (TDW +2.2%) is higher following late yesterday's disclosure that it reached a settlement with a U.S. shipyard to resolve all outstanding disputes related to the construction of two 5,400 dwt deepwater platform supply vessels.
    • TDW says it will receive a $233K credit against the contract price with respect to the first PSV due to actual deadweight being under the deadweight guaranties and will reimburse the shipyard for certain expenses; delivery of the first PSV occurred on Nov. 22.
    • In the second PSV, TDW will receive a credit for liquidated damages due to any inability of the vessel to attain contracted deadweight guarantee when testing is performed at a later date, and will reimburse the shipyard for certain expenses; the second PSV is expected to be delivered by June 2018.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • SMTC

    Semtech - 3.9% after Q3 beats, downside guidance

    • Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC) shares are down 3.9% after yesterday’s Q3 results beat EPS and revenue estimates but issued downside guidance.
    • Q4 guidance: revenue, $138M to $142M (consensus: $152.97M); EPS, $0.40 to $0.42 (consensus: $0.47). 
    • Analyst color: Drexel Hamilton reiterates Buy rating with a $45 price target, calling the quarter healthy though the outlook was softer than expected.       
    • Previously: Semtech beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • RGC

    Regal Entertainment drops on report of Cineworld financing hiccup

    • Regal Entertainment (NYSE:RGC) is down 5.25% after Dealreporter suggests that Cineworld (OTC:CNWGY) may have difficulty in lining up financing for a takeover.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Investors size up Regal Entertainment-Cineworld development (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • SRRA

    Sierra Oncology adds to up move ahead of data update on Chk1 inhibitor SRA737; shares ahead 7%

    • Micro cap Sierra Oncology (SRRA +6.7%) is up on above-average volume. Shares have rallied ~55% since the low of $1.97 on November 16.
    • No particular news accounts for the action, but the company is due to update investors on the clinical development of SRA737 early next quarter.
    • SRA737 is an orally available inhibitor of an enzyme called checkpoint kinase 1 (Chk1), a serine-threonine kinase that plays a key role in the DNA repair mechanism. Inhibiting its action hinders the ability of cancer cells to survive and proliferate.
    • Eli Lilly (LLY -0.2%) is developing an intravenously administered Chk1 inhibitor called prexasertib (LY2606368) that it licensed from Array BioPharma (ARRY +0.9%) via its $2.1B acquisition of ICOS in 2007.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 14 Comments
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble to focus on smaller stores

    • Barnes & Noble (BKS -11.9%) says it will focus on smaller stores as part of a strategy to highlight the books business.
    • The retailer plans to refine its store base as leases come due over the next few years.
    • Management also highlighted during today's earnings conference call the difficult comparison it ran into this year due to the sizzling demand for Harry Potter books in Q3 of 2016.
    • Shares of B&N have given up a good portion of their gains struck earlier this month after it was reported the company had a go-private offer in hand.
    • Source: Barnes & Noble earnings call
    • Previously: Back to books at Barnes & Noble (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 5 Comments
  • TAT

    TransAtlantic Petroleum to launch new drilling program

    • TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +15.1%) pushes higher after announcing the launch of a new drilling program and entry into a new $20.4M term loan.
    • TAT says it plans to begin drilling the Selmo-81H1 well starting in Q1 2018 and is working to identify additional wells to follow, while also evaluating prospects in the Thrace Basin in Turkey following Valeura Energy's positive interim production test results at the Yamalik-1 exploration well in a license directly adjacent to TAT's licenses, which cover ~120K net acres.
    • TAT also says it will pay the upcoming quarterly dividends on its series A preferred shares in cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 12 Comments
  • STMP

    Stamps.com lower after CEO sells shares

    • Stamps.com (STMP -6.2%) trades lower after a round of insider selling from CEO Thomas McBride.
    • McBride sold 141,733 shares on November 27 at $180.01 and 400 shares on November 28 at $180.59.
    • SEC Form 4
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 7 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: OTC:ARDM +22%. CHFS +17%. VSTM +12%. SRRA +11%. ADMP +11%.
    • Losers: MYO -22%. PZRX -11%. CHEK -11%. CERC -8%. EKSO -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • PBA

    Pembina Pipeline OKs two major new capital projects

    • Pembina Pipeline (PBA +1.9%) is higher after its board approves C$400M in new capital projects and announces a 2018 capital program of C$1.3B.
    • The newly approved Prince Rupert Terminal in British Columbia will have a permitted capacity of ~25K bbl/day of liquefied petroleum gas and is expected to be in service by mid-2020; the expected capital cost has been adjusted to C$250M from C$270M.
    • Also, the North Central Liquids Hub project is estimated capital cost of C$320M - C$150M net to PBA - and is expected to be placed into service in late 2018.
    • PBA says it plans to spend C$540M in its conventional pipelines business next year, or 40% of its overall 2018 capital spending plan, and C$260M, or 19% of the overall budget, in its midstream business.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 6 Comments

    Fusion announces two new contracts totaling over $1.6M

  • SD

    WSJ: Icahn considers board fight at SandRidge Energy

    • Carl Icahn has sent a letter to SandRidge Energy's (SD +2.2%) board criticizing its move to block him from buying more shares, WSJ reports.
    • In his letter, Icahn says SD has hit “a new low in corporate governance,” and the poison pill to block any shareholder from buying more than 10% of the company's shares would “make a totalitarian dictator blush," according to the report.
    • The letter also seeks clarity on whether the poison pill would block the ability to talk to other shareholders about voting against SD's proposed purchase of Bonanza Creek Energy or calling a special meeting to change the board; Icahn requests a response by Dec. 8.

  • NOK

    Natixis: Arista a more compelling deal than Juniper for Nokia

    • After taking a near-25% ride higher in postmarket trade yesterday on a report of deal talks with Nokia (NYSE:NOK), Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) is 8.3% lower premarket following Nokia's definitive denial that any purchase is being prepared.
    • A note from Natixis suggests a deal is "very unlikely" considering how emphatic Nokia's statement was. An integration would be tough in any case, but Nokia had a rough go integrating Alcatel-Lucent and Siemens Networks, Natixis says.
    • Arista Networks (NYSE:ANET) would be a more compelling tie-up, the firm suggests, with a better growth dynamic. But even that deal is unlikely as it would call for a premium and end up in a 50/50 ownership structure though Nokia generates 10 times the revenue. (h/t Blooomberg)
    • Arista's also taking share from Juniper (and Cisco) in the switching market, where Nokia would have hoped to have made gains with a Juniper deal. Arista is up 1.2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 5 Comments

  • AAPL

    Nikkei: Apple will design main power management chips for iPhones (update)

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will use its own main power management chip design in iPhones within the next two years, according to Nikkei Asian Review sources.
    • The chip controls the phone’s charging, battery management, and energy efficiency. Designing its own chip would give Apple more control over the quality and cost.
    • The move would remove its dependence on Dialog Semiconductor (OTCPK:DLGNF), which exclusively supplies the chips for the iPhone, iPad, and Watch.
    • Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (NYSE:TSM) makes Dialog’s chips and could become the sole maker of Apple’s chips.
    • Apple represented 74% of Dialog’s revenue and 17% of Taiwan Semi’s overall revenue last year.
    • Earlier this year, graphic chips supplier Imagination Technologies announced that Apple would stop using its chips within two years. Shares tanked, and Imagination went up for sale. China-backed private equity fund Canyon Bridge made an offer for the company in September.
    • Dialog shares are down 22.8% on the Frankfurt exchange.
    • Taiwan Semi shares are up 1.5% premarket.
    • Apple shares are up 0.57%.
    • Previously: Imagination Technologies will delist tomorrow after High Court approval (Nov. 2)
    • Previously: Chinese firm offers to buy Apple's former chip supplier (Sept. 25)
    • Previously: Canyon Bridge founder accused of insider trading; firm still plans acquisition (update) (Oct. 31)
    • Update: Dialog says the design cycle visibility of its main client remains unchanged and is in-line with normal business.
    • Correction: Corrected the Reuters link in the update.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 40 Comments
